page.lettertext:
fol.333r
Belgia: 1590. Decemb
r
.
Belgia [.]
[Dec]
em
b
[To my]
L. Trea
s
May it please yo
r
good L. yesternight the generall states sent their
Greffier
unto mee w
th
an awnswer to her
Ma
ty
in
e matters
posed
by
M
r
Wilk
and mee, To the end that yo
r
L. might p
nt
ly have yt
I tooke no leisure to
use yt, but red yt ov
r
coursory wise & caused
a coppie to bee speedily written, w
ch
I have joyned to this letter,
beseeching yo
r
L. to impart yt w
th
her Ma
ty
. I did nev
r
yet imagine
that
ey would frame any awnswer to satisfie her Hig[nes, yet I
thought yt should have made a more plausible showe, then theyr
oth
r
Awnswers heertofore to
e self same demaund
, but to my
und
r
standing yt hath bin apparant of a long time, that because they
have resolved to gouvern all alone, they will seeke indirectly to
frustrate
e Contract, & to free their estate of her Hig
nes
autority.
By
e date of theyr Apostilles it is 2 monethes ago, that all
was concluded, w
ch
I knowe not wh
r
uppon they have staied in theyr
hand
, It is said that their Deputies de
te w
th
in these 2 daies, who
as I do und
r
stand do openly refuse to deale in oth
r
causes then
the matter of traffique. Nev
r
theles they have taken a transcript
both of o
r
propositions &
e foresayd Apostilles, & have secret
Instructions, how to awnswer to any thing
t
may bee objected.
As yet I have not heard from yo
r
L. what her Ma
ty
doth intend
about
e l
res
to
e Provinces for w
ch
in my opinion
e Oportunity
is lost, but yf her Hig
nes
will vouchsafe to signe that one, for
Mons
r
Buis
, to
e states of
Utrecht
, yt will stand him p
nt
ly in steed
& give him cause to bee
swaded, that his honest endevo
rs
are
gratefully remembered. Ever synce
Co. Maurice
missed of his
purpose in
e enterprise of
Donkerk
wee have had in a maner
cessation of armes, the Co. being busied in his goverment
of
Utrecht &
overyssell
, wher as yet he remayneth. The
Councell
of state
hath required
e states g
na
l to move
e Provinces for an
extraordinary levy of 3000 foote & 300 horse to be employed in
e
field for half a year, what successe yt will have I cannot signify
but
e assembly of
e states is earnestly bent to
e furderance of yt
& have made to
t
effect a Remonstrance to
e Provinces.
Wee are secretly adv
r
tised, & as yt is conceaved, very truely, that
e
ennemy doth
vide for
e p
nt
surprise of some spetiall place
w
ch
is supposed (for as yet wee have no c
r
tainty) to bee either
Berghen
or
Breda
, By reason wh
r
of they have sent
M
r
Gilpin
to Berghen
& an oth
r
to Breda to forewarne
e Gouverno
rs
. Howbeyt theyr
chiefest feare is of Berghen. Where the Enemy hath lately assayed
w
th
mises of great reward
to move
e
lady Morgan
to
swade
her
husband
to revolt, But for the discharge of theyr dewties, they have
delt as yt seemeth very discretly, espetially
e Governo
r
, of whom &
of all
e practise of
e enemy, & also of that w
ch
hath passed
about yt, in
e Councell of state I will write yo
r
L. in my next.
It is adv
r
tised from
Bruxelles
that
e
D. of Parma
doth assemble
the states of those countrys, as yt is thought in
Andwerp
, & for a new
contribution, as w
th
all yt is signified, that there wilbee at
e assembly
fol.333v
Belgia: 1590 Decemb
r
:
To my L. Treasuro
r
by
Perseval
De
c
7 1590
two Deputies from
e E mperor, w
th
comission to propose unto
em
& w
th
them a g
na
l peace to
e
united Provinces
The brute that
is abroad of this proposition, the suddain retourne of
e D of Parma
&
e
Liguers
desyre to come to agreement (for so yt is reported)
doth putt many men in belief, that
K Phillip
is dead, w
ch
is
the effect of as much as I can signify at this p
nt
,
for w
ch
I
take my h
u
ble leave. De
c
7. 1590.
